app module¶

app.create_tables()[source]¶

Create the classes table in the database.

If it exists, it is dropped before re-creation.

app.export_to_csv()[source]¶

Export classes from the database into a CSV file named output.csv.

Reads data from the existing CSV (referenced by file_path) and updates enrollment values using the database. Ensures the first row is the term, the second row is the generation date/time, and subsequent rows contain updated class info.

Returns:

JSON response indicating success or an error message.

Return type:

flask.Response

Status 200:

Successfully exported data to file.

Status 404:

No database or error accessing records.

app.get_class(class_id)[source]¶

Retrieve information about a single class using its numeric ID.

Args:
class_id (int):

The ID of the class to fetch from the database.

Returns:
flask.Response:

A JSON response with two possible outcomes:

  • 200 OK – If the class is found, returns a JSON object of class data.

  • 404 Not Found – If the class is not found, returns a JSON error message.

app.get_classes()[source]¶

Retrieve a list of classes from the database.

A connection to the SQLite database is established, and all records are fetched from the classes table. The attributes fetched are id, section, course_number, and course_title. These are returned as a JSON array.

Returns:

JSON response containing the list of class objects along with an HTTP 200 status.

Return type:

flask.Response

app.insert_csv_into_table(course_data)[source]¶

Insert parsed CSV data into the classes table.

Parameters:

course_data (list) – List of dictionaries with course info.

app.parse_csv(csv_document)[source]¶

Parse the CSV file and return structured course data.

Skips the first two lines before reading headers.

Parameters:

csv_document (str) – Path to the CSV file.

Returns:

List of dictionaries representing each course entry.

Return type:

list

app.update_enrollment(class_id)[source]¶

Update enrollment for a specific class by ID.

Increments or decrements the enrollment number according to the request (add or remove). If the maximum capacity is reached, adding is not allowed. If enrollment is zero, removing is not allowed.

Parameters:

class_id (int) – ID of the class to update.

Returns:

JSON response containing the updated enrollment or an error message.

Return type:

flask.Response

Status 200:

Class found and enrollment updated successfully.

Status 400:

Invalid update (e.g., class is full or empty).

Status 404:

Class not found.

app.upload_file()[source]¶

Upload and process a CSV file.

Note

Expects a form field named file.

Returns:

JSON response indicating success or failure.

Return type:

flask.Response
